Views, PREvIEws
AMD REVIEWS


Edward Banks

My spouse. Edward and | we're
just preparing to settle down,
relax and enjoy our refurbished
and remodeled home, when 1t
happened.


There 1t was sure sign Of
trouble--a spiral of water was
coming from under the retrig-
orator. I placed some old towels
down on the area and we went
to bed. The next morning, there
was more water coming from the
side of the refrigerator.


We sighed and looked around
and decided we would go out and
purchase new refrigerator. My
husband and l had figured we
would revamp the kitchen around
Christmas. But. here we we're
on the prowl for a new refrig-
orator. We looked at several
makes and models and finally
chose a frost clear model with
a large freezer section.


While we we're out we decided
to purchase a new dinette set
because the new appliance would
certainly show Its drabness.


The new refrigerator and the
dinette set have been delivered.
The sink and cabinets now look
a bit out of place, but the htch-
en- will hold its own.


Little odds and ends of the
house are falling into place. We
have had the old bathroom remod-
eled and 1t looks like one out of
the decorator guide. All white
and gold. 1t CLEANS and since
it was strictly my husbands
idea--it is his room.


He has given me the new bath
room--now we are not only two
car family, but a two bathroom
family, as we'll. Where else but
in the good old United States Of
America could you expect such.


l predict that in the future
each house or apartment will
be erected with one bath and one
carport or garage per inhabitant.


Instead Of having population
boom-the economists and soli-
ologists could go quite mad wond-
ering how to manage the bath
bulge or the automobile boom.


AS soon as the outer planets
are contacted we will make the
first ascent and discover how they
manage without one or none,
(baths or cars).


The house we live In Is now
complete and we have gotten most
Of our paraphenalia transferred
from place to place.


The windows need a bit of
washing on the outside and there
are a few extra rocks in the
yard-but-the job is done.


| knew we we're through when
my husband took his ceramic
planter to the nursery and got
a new plant. He has been saying
that he would try another living
plant when we got air condi-
tioning--now we have 1t and he has
his green thing.


In the words of famous writer
"All's we'll that ends WE'LL

Siuhts and Sounds
ELoIsE BANKS
Last Chapter

Recommendations of the first conference
sponsored by the city's human relations COM
mission Included several basis proposals
which are para mount in handling the teTTaoR
blight of many Americans.


In our city not only are pubic occomnao-
dati0ns to be opened, but employment obp0T-
tuuities and housing, should be likewise open
to 0n


For many years there haze been programs
launched to inspire young students to stay in
school and prepare for better jobs. There has
been a halheayted attempt on the part Of many
high school cOunse l0ys to ten pupils of MIN
GRITTY groups TO take more training. Nothing
helps it seems unless job opportunities are
opened and students can see for themselves
that Negroes are actually hired in certain
positions.


In the Valley several glayinag problems
weYe studied by the conference and Mayor Gya-
ham summed the meeting UP by asking for
local churches to support the program to inn
prone race relations.


One Of the 0utgYOaOthS Of the conference mas
the co'nmiss ion's request for support for
housing code. This wiu take a great deal Of
work. Let's not forget employment as ne stTive
to improve the conditions of the nainoyities.
The ability to pay for housing and public &C.
cOnamOd0tiOns is more important than any
other facet Improving the conditions of man.
kind.

The Arizona Committee for the John F.
Kennedy Memorial Library lacks Negro
member. In UieU of the fact that so many
Negroes felt deeply inspired because Of the
late presidents chill rights stand, 1T seems
a bit iYOniC.


Certainly, the naming Of one Negro Mould
giUe recognition to the race. President Ken
nedy's memorial drive should haze greater
impact in the everyday lives Of more citi-
zens and Negro on the committee would be
beneficial.


Several Negro organizations including the
Elks, the National A ociatiOn for the Advance
memt Of Coloyed People and the Alpha Phi
A. bh0 fraternity haze dedicated their pro-
grams to President Kennedy.


1t is an atfyont to the thousands of Negroes
who hOe in the state a0aen no Negro was ab-
pointed to serve on the Kennedy Memorial
Library Committee.
